page.title: 09BINGHAM LINEAR PARK
page.content: You may enjoy the Bingham Linear Park and its country walks from an entrance off the A52 or by way of a zig-zag stepped pathway from the spinney on Tythby Road which is on the way from Langar to Bingham. The park follows the route of the former Nottingham to Melton Mowbray railway line. It runs in an easterly direction from the A52 trunk road to the west of the town for a distance of 2 miles to the River Smite bridge at Whatton. Most of the disused railway track is now grassed over and planted with shrubs, trees and wild flowers including Lesser Celandines, Daisies, Poppies and Lesser Spearworts. However to the east, where walking is less easy, you may follow the original track base to find panoramic views of the local and distant coutryside.
